intro: Gochnatia calcicola, commonly known as the limestone gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, limestone-rich soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Gochnatia calcicola is often found in shrublands and is a component of the local flora in regions with specific soil conditions.
